Our monthly employee newsletter with company updates and announcements -----
April 2022 Edition

Welcome to the Latest Edition of 
The Justia Insider

Greetings everyone! Welcome to April's edition of The Justia Insider. We are ready to make the most of this new month. Let's take a look at this month's insights and find out what's been going on at Justia during the last few weeks. Any comments or questions? Support our commitment to improving employee communication.

Milestones & Accomplishments

Let’s Find Out What’s Been Achieved So Far by Our Teams at Justia

Justia Elevate: We finally launched our new Justia Elevate service! Even more good news: our first Justia Elevate sign-up happened on March 30th, 2022. This is a notable achievement for Justia, indeed.

Justia Ask a Lawyer Analysis: Our team generated a complete data report on Justia Ask a Lawyer's activity and insights that will provide helpful information to guide the company to move in the right direction to achieve our goals.

Justia Amplify Ads: We launched Justia's "Got PPC?" marketing campaign via banners on our different web properties and through an email campaign.

State Codes: We published eleven new state code versions for New Jersey, Delaware, and D.C. (2021) and the 2019 version of the U.S. Codes.

Oyez Development: We enhanced our development process for Oyez.org by dockerizing the backend application. This advancement will allow our development team to handle ongoing application improvements better.

WordPress Upgrades: We keep maintaining our WordPress installations up to date. The latest upgrade occurred for our LawBlogger and BlawgCloud client installations.

JUSTIA PORTAL NEWS

Take a Look at the Ongoing Development of Our Consumer Portal
  • Additional Snippets. We have improved the accessibility and clarity of the Immigration Legal Guide by writing more snippets to highlight key points in this area.
  • Additional Case Law Outlines. We have continued writing case outlines for law school elective courses, such as Entertainment Law, Sports Law, and Family Law.
  • Onward Blog Posts Highlighting Legal Guides. We wrote a couple of posts on our Justia Onward blog explaining how consumers could use our Birth Injuries Center and our business incorporation guides, such as this California guide.
  • Review of Case Law Resources. We have started identifying areas for improvement in the case law section of the portal and developing strategies to address them.
  • Justia Mexico Legal Portal. The resources available on our Justia Mexico Legal Portal, such as laws and legal content, have been referenced as a source of information and mentioned in initiatives in the Mexican Congress, journalistic papers, and magazines such as Business Insider. Our content has also appeared in other media such as W Radio, Milenio, Radio Formula, Expansion, and El Comercio, to name a few.

NEW TEAM MEMBERS

Getting to Know the New Talent at Justia

Jose Morales

Intern - IT Team

I am a software engineering student at the Autonomous University of Nuevo Leon and I am about to graduate in six months. Previously, I did professional internships at the Self-Learning Language Center of the Mechanical and Electrical Engineering School. I like to learn new things. My goal is to find my way in my career.

Omar Mendoza

Intern - Engineering Team

Hello, my name is Omar. I want to learn something new every day. Formula 1 is my favorite sport to watch and basketball my favorite sport to play, and I hope to have a fantastic time here at Justia.

Jacob Klipper

Sales Team

I'm a digital marketing/sales-driven, creative-minded individual. I love learning new things dealing with business, sales, and digital marketing from others. I have a passion for basically anything to deal with technology. For example, I used my mother's eBay account as an eBay PowerSeller back in 2003. If a computer was around, I was behind it. I am a networker like no other on certain platforms, so If I had not attempted to add you on Linkedin already, make sure to connect!

Alfredo Galvan

Engineering Team

Hi! I’m Alfredo Galvan, I am 30 years old and I'm from Saltillo, Coahuila. I am a back-end developer, but I want to become a full-stack developer soon. I love to play video games, and I consider myself competitive. I love music, and I enjoy singing and playing the guitar. I’m really excited to learn new stuff from you all.

Jonatan Reynosa

My favorite hobbies are playing video games, listening to music, and playing a few musical instruments. I'm excited to start this new journey and work with you all.

I'm passionate about learning anything that seems exciting and challenging for me. I like to read and play video games with friends during my free time.

UPCOMING HOLIDAYS

Dates to Remember
Children’s Day
April 30th

Every April 30th, there is an annual celebration to pay tribute to children in Mexico. Children are celebrated as an essential part of society in Mexico, so this day focuses on the importance of loving, accepting, and appreciating our children.Happy Children’s Day, everyone!

REVIEWS & RECOMMENDATIONS

Gates of Europe: A History of Ukraine

Available on Amazon

"Written by an award-winning historian, this thorough but reasonably concise volume brings Ukraine out of the shadow of Russia more than most narratives. Gates of Europe captures the richness of Ukraine’s history and culture, helping explain why its people fight fiercely for their freedom."

- Chris Skelton

Collaborators: Erika Azuela, Miguel Berlanga, Haydee Garcia, Arturo Jara, Alejandro Moreno, Alejandra Medina, Lauren Moskie, Rene Peralta, Jose Ramos and Zoraida Vallejo.
